content: needle which is now in the back wrap your the stitches together drop the two original stitches working yarn around the right needle and pull off the needles through knitting the stitches together drop the mc - main colour original two stitches off the needles pm - place marker ws - wrong side legend and a note on reading charts throughout the turner socks pattern the colourwork charts are read from the bottom to the mc c c top and from the right to the left sections outlined in red are the pattern repeat to work a round begin by working the stitches to the right of the outlined repeat next work the pattern repeat you will do this until the number of stitches remaining in the round is the same as the number of stitches shown to the left of the outlined pattern repeat in the chart for this pattern that is always one stitch you will always work a full pattern repeat never a partial repeat work the final stitch as shown in the chart 4 @thestitchling cuff note you may find the german twisted cast on and setting up your magic loop videos helpful for this section using your 2 25mm us 1 needles and the german twisted cast on loosely cast on 53 61 69 77 85 93 stitches in your mc if you struggle to cast on loosely you can cast on with a 2 5mm us 1 5 needle and then slide the stitches onto a 2 25mm us 1 needle ready to knit fold the cable of your 2 25mm us 1 needles in half so that the two needles are next to each other and then cast on around both needles slide one needle free ready to knit note to arrange your needles for magic loop position the first 13 15 17 19 21 23 stitches on the left needle place the central 26 30 34 38 42 46 stitches in the middle of the cable position the final 14 16 18 20 22 24 stitches on the right needle this means that whilst working the leg of your sock your bor won t be at the weak point where you pull the cable through but in the centre of one of the two sets of stitches ensure that the stitches are not twisted join in the round slip the first stitch on the left needle onto the right needle purlwise pass the last cast-on stitch over and off as though binding off return the slipped stitch to the left needle gently pull the working yarn to tighten the join place bor marker you should have 52 60 68 76 84 92 stitches on your needles rounds 1-15 all stitches worked in mc *knit 1 purl 2 knit 1* repeat until the bor leg note you may find the left- and right-leaning decreases video helpful for this section you have finished working the ribbed cuff and will now work the leg set-up
